name: places/ChIJ-6ZxFif2wokRaRaETTJc_9Q
formattedAddress: 808 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 808 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA

editorialSummary.text: Eco-minded chain with natural & organic grocery items, housewares & other products (most sell wine).

originalText.text: A decent place for groceries and health products of various sorts. You can expect the goods and services of whole foods here. Depending on the time and day of week, it'll be busier or more relaxed, but expect a steady stream of people. Seating area seems spacious, but there are always a ton of people hanging out, so don't expect leisurely calm and quiet. Subpar salad station that seems to never change and not that fresh. Baked goods are standard quality, produce and meats above average quality and tons of healthy snacks. Yes, you will pay for it.

originalText.text:
Want to personally thank Melo for being a superhero for your that shop at Wholefoods.
So happy that Corporate choose you for the location at Columbus Circle.
You are the epitome of what excellent management looks like.
Thank you for finding someone to make coffee today.
Thank you for caring about your customers. Can not tell you how grateful I am to your amazing service.
Loved my entire shopping experience. All of the employees at this location are awesome!!!

originalText.text: I just had the worst customer service experience at this Whole Foods location. My roommates and I went shopping together, but rung up separately @ self check out. When one of my roommates encountered an error on the screen— telling her she had too many bags and the total was higher than it should be —she moved to another register. For some reason, this irked one of the employees working here. After aggressively yelling at me to come back to the register (despite it not being my items & I had already paid) he accused me of stealing. He took my receipt and crumpled it up. Explaining the situation and showing him my receipt along with 1 item I had purchased was not effective in calming him down. My roommate came over asking him to just void or cancel the transaction because it was having problems, but he insisted she had to pay the higher total. Since she had finished at another register already, she said she would not. Before we knew it, he was yelling at his boss about us. Then, we were told to go to customer service. Of course, my lack of receipt only caused more problems. When I asked the register attendant if he would give me my receipt back, he ignored me. While we were happy to display that we did not steal, we were disappointed in the employees for not listening to us when we were explaining what actually happened. No proof was enough. It was belittling. They re-rung up all our items only to find we never stole. Very disappointed with this customer service, the worst I have ever had at a Whole Foods. As a fellow retail worker myself, I would never treat a customer the way I was treated— with such disrespect.

originalText.text: We stayed at Carriage House for a recent getaway. We've stayed here many times in the past. The new owners and manager do an outstanding job in keeping with Carriage House tradition of attention to detail, cleanliness, and excellence. Highly recommend!

text.text: We stayed at Carriage House for a recent getaway. We've stayed here many times in the past. The new owners and manager do an outstanding job in keeping with Carriage House tradition of attention to detail, cleanliness, and excellence. Highly recommend!

originalText.text: This location of Whole Foods Market, which is on Columbus Avenue in the Upper West Side neighborhood (near Central Park West), is really lovely! I recently began to frequent this spot on the weekends for quick grocery runs and I have been very content with each trip. The store is clean & well-kept, there is always a stock of the items I need, and the staff are really kind!
